laboratory_examinations.findings: Serial CSF analyses revealed ongoing inflammation (pleocytosis and elevated protein; reference range in dotted lines) and recurrent isolation of C. albicans (+), despite antifungals.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptom resolution and normalization of CSF parameters occurred after adjunctive GM-CSF therapy was initiated.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Zymosan-stimulated peripheral blood mononuclear cells showed impaired GM-CSF gene expression relative to GAPDH with decreased GM-CSF production compared to healthy controls.
Serum voriconazole levels ranged from 0.22 to 1.53 Âµg/mL.
